website_summaries.verdict: This sleek ceramic dish is ideal for cats with plastic sensitivities. Hygienic, easy to fill, and suitable for all paw sizes.
pros: Ceramic construction is safe for cats with plastic allergies and helps prevent acne
Openings accommodate even the largest paws
Effectively slows eating without causing too much frustration
cons: Enthusiastic eaters might manage to pull it around hard floors
Needs to be placed on a non-slip mat

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that the kibble bumps up against a lip on the side of the dish, and there it remains. Maybe this disk was designed for larger kitty food than we feed our cat, but changing our cat food is not an option. Others reviewers have pointed out that eventually, your kitty will figure out how to get the food out of the bowl. However, even after navigating the side lip, the bowl has a channel around the perimeter that once again traps the food. All in all, this design is more trouble than it is worth. I do not recommend this product, and suggest you look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Felice

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for cats who gobble
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who gobbles and then soon throws up. Yuck. A couple of years ago I saw one of the fingers-sticking-up feeder trays and it greatly improved the problem...if I didn't fill it too full. That was hard to do. So I saw a review for this one and took a chance. After initial fits that I had changed the feeder, both of my cats really like this model. They do like hunting for their food. Plus it solved the filling it too full problem I had. I am really impressed with this product. It is perfect for cats who need to slow down their eating.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine M

customer_reviews.title: Slows fast-eaters, works for front-declawed cats
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this food dish. We have two cats, both are front-declawed. One is lean and smart while the other is overweight, gobbles his food, and a little bit dumb. My smart cat wasted no time figuring out how to use his paw to scoop individual pieces of food or whole piles of food out of this dish. My dumb cat is still figuring it out, and but is no longer able to wolf his food down like he would from a normal bowl.
customer_reviews.author: El

customer_reviews.title: One word: Lead
customer_reviews.text: Tested positive for lead. I used several test sticks to be sure. Do not purchase unless you want to poison your pet. Shame on them for selling this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Helped my cat slow down eating, no more puke!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have known about this product a looong time ago. My older cat here recently started throwing up constantly. Took her to the vet and they did x-rays, exams and blood work. Everything was coming back normal. They gave me a special food, which she hated, and said to keep an eye on her. It was then that I noticed she was eating super fast. Needless to say since getting this feeder she has stopped throwing up. Highly recommend it! At first she hated me and would just look at me with death threatening glares but she is really taking to it now.
customer_reviews.author: K Croley

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer Pet Tiger diner food dish is a hit with our kitty.
customer_reviews.text: My year old kitty started binging and purging on her kibble. I saw this bowl on Catster magazine and went to Amazon to buy it. Amazon beat the Pioneer Pet website by $5.00. And I got free shipping. At first Ruby didn't know what to make of it, but with a little coaching after a couple days, she got the hang of it and now easily pulls out the kibble with her paws. No more binging on her kibble and she hasn't vomited since. It teaches your kitty how to hunt for her food and eat slowly. What a find! I would recommend to anyone who's kitty is binging on her kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Young

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, useful feeder!
customer_reviews.text: My smallest cat struggles with eating - she vomits from eating too fast. I tried several different "slow feeders", and this was the winner by far! She can use her hunting skills to paw into the openings for food, and just the right amount of food comes out at a time. No more puking! This is a very attractive bowl - sturdy, shiny, and very nice design. It is also easy to clean with some basic dish soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: J. Condrey

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra few bucks for ceramic
customer_reviews.text: I initially got the plastic model from another website (same brand though) and it was nice to make sure my cat would learn how to use it, but really the plastic model is useless. It's two separate pieces that don't firmly lock together and it's lightweight enough that my cat, when frustrated enough, picked up the whole thing and separated the two pieces and spilled all the food onto the floor. She's not particularly smart or strong either. I just got the ceramic version and it's solved all the little annoyances so I couldn't be happier. It's helped her slow down her eating which is helping her lose some weight and she cries for food less.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great portion control
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 cats that both ate all the food in the bowl as soon as you filled it. One got fat and the other would eat so fast she puked. We bought this to see how it worked and it's perfect. Now they eat some and walk away since they have to work for it. The vet commented on the fat cat's weight being much better at the last visit and we told her about the bowl. She said several other people had told her how well these bowl work. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gumby

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me, then didn't.  Might work for you!
customer_reviews.text: My cats really hate this thing. The lip at the bottom is too wide for them to get any food out, and if there is another food bowl close by they will ignore this one altogether. That being said, it did stop my cat from puking up her food every day from eating too quickly in the beginning. After a while it stopped working, and now I just feed her in a separate room so she doesn't feel like she has to scarf down her food. I don't consider this to be a waste of money because it did work for a bit, and everything with cats is touch and go.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Slows your pets eating without frustration.
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few different types of puzzles but the canals were too small for our pets paws to get into in fact too small for our fingers to get into to get the kibble. these feeders are perfect for our cats as it does slow them down but not frustrate them as they can get the kibble with relative ease but at a much slower Pace then an open bowl. Very easy to simply poor little kibble at the top and it's distributed nicely throughout the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: B T

customer_reviews.title: Slows Your Cats Eating Down, Develops Their Coordination
customer_reviews.text: This is our third purchase of this bowl. We have one for each cat. All three are prone to vomiting from eating too quickly and/or overeating. This prevents issues resulting from the first problem, and I’d say has cut down their getting sick by at least 90%. It also develops their coordination as they learn to use their paws more like hands to scoop the kibble out. Sometimes a piece comes shooting out and they have to stop it like a goalie, or chase it down. It’s actually really fun to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Landers

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Slows down my cat's eating because it starts in the top funnel. If he eats too aggressively, he pushes the food down into the base. He then uses his paw to get food out from underneath. Does not move around. Only issue I have is to monitor his food intake, I take the top off and then put whatever food is left on bottom back into bag and then start again. Not a problem, just stating its a bit more work, but much better than having to clean up throw up spots around house.
customer_reviews.author: toml

customer_reviews.title: Quality ceramic bowl! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice, quality ceramic bowl. My cats are still figuring out how to use it but so far I am really liking it. The only thing I worry about a little is my larger cat getting his paws stuck in the smaller holes, but so far so good. The edges of the holes are smooth so I think that helps prevent paws, claws, and fur from catching or snagging. I would definitely recommend this product if you have cats that tend to scarf and barf.
customer_reviews.author: Mulvi90

customer_reviews.title: Quality Ceramic Bowl!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice, quality ceramic bowl. My cats are still figuring out how to use it but so far I am really liking it. The only thing I worry about a little is my larger cat getting his paws stuck in the smaller holes, but so far so good. The edges of the holes are smooth so I think that helps prevent paws, claws, and fur from catching or snagging. I would definitely recommend this product if you have cats that tend to scarf and barf.
customer_reviews.author: Mulvi90

customer_reviews.title: Solved Eating Problems!
customer_reviews.text: This product really helped work our my cats' eating issues! I have a female that can be trusted to not overeat and a male who will eat anything in sight. Because of this, the male kept eating the female's leftover food from her dish, leaving her hungry and grumpy and him gradually getting fatter. Now I put 1/2 their food in their regular dishes and the other 1/2 in the feeder. Our male dabbles at the feeder bowl a little, but leaves most of it for the female to graze on as she gets hungry. Now he's losing weight and she's much sweeter with her full belly. Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hanchett

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: Using this has completely stopped my cats from throwing up. This bowl works great, is easy to fill, and even looks nice in my kitchen. I use this along with standard food bowls for my two cats. I feed partial in a standard bowl then fill this with enough to snack on throughout the day, helping them eat less quickly and have less arguments over food. My older cat had a bit longer of a learning curve but after a few days they both enjoy it. I put felt on the bottom to protect my wood floors because the cats would push this around a bit when using.
customer_reviews.author: Devin B

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every pennies!
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Mickey, has food disorder (binge), he can't stop hogs the food nor slow chewing. He always puke everytime he finishes his meal. It has been ongoing problem for couple years, he got a health clean bill, it is just that he's too lazy and chubby as much as Garfield. I've been trying out few products to help slow his consumption process and to stop him from puking it, almost all of the products I have tried isn't work very well for him. I got this Pioneer Pet a week ago and his problem disappeared. I cant expressively enough how thankful I am to owning this, a peace of mind and a solution to his binge disorder.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Love the effectiveness of dish, hate how hard it is to clean between her feedings
customer_reviews.text: Has been great to slow down the speed my cat scarfs down wet cat food. It has worked very well to stop her throwing up, like she always did when she ate too fast. Was glad that this feeding dish did not cause my cat to stop eating. She seemed to easily learn how to get the food in this dish, but that process she has to use to get the food slows down her eating just enough to prevent her throwing up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Love it for weight control & entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Great to prevent chubby kitties and provide enrichment, making cats 'hunt' for food. Love that they go right in the dishwasher. I'm a repeat customer. I had spares to use while they were being washed but gave them away to a friend. Prefer the white vs. black because it's easier to see how much food is left.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Great, quality product
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is a great product. Our cat just started eating too fast and getting sick. We tried another slow feeder but he was able to still eat straight from the dish and would still get sick every once in a while. This keeps him occupied and interested, and he seems less frantic and desperate to be fed, even though he is getting the same amount. It’s heavy and high quality, he can’t flip it or “cheat”. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: beccamarie

customer_reviews.title: Design is flawed
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes to gorge and purge. This dish helps her slow down her feeding and it prevents the purging. We have to use this dish upside down. When it's right side up, she sticks her paw in to pick out the food, but there is a lip between the bottom of the bowl, and the opening of the lower cutouts. She ends up dragging the bowl around the room without being able to get any of her food out. It's really sad to watch. I turn it upside down, and pour in the food via a funnel. She's able to paw her food out that way.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I put treats in it at first to ensure the cats had a postive interaction. Then I added food and eventually took away the original bowl. I was surprised to see them use it even when they still had food in the old bowl. I think they like having to dig it out.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: We got this dish . . . and she hasn't vomited since.
customer_reviews.text: This dish is brilliant! We tried a variety of things to help prevent our cat from vomiting, but nothing really seemed to help. Then we got this dish to slow down her eating, and months later, she hasn't vomited since. She simply scoops out the kibble one by one and only eats what she needs. No more wasted kibble. Mealtime is more interesting for her as she now has to "catch" her food. The opening at the top makes it easy to add more kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Fawntastic

customer_reviews.title: Cat feeder works!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 brother kitties, but one tends to over eat. The normal one is also the smart one, who figured out how to get the the food out out. The overweight one just waits to clean up what's left, and seems to at least, not be gaining too much extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Katie M

customer_reviews.title: 75% Less cat vomiting  episodes
customer_reviews.text: It took my cat about a week to figure out this bowl. I was happy because it slowed down his eating for the first few weeks which meant I didn't have to clean up cat vomit. Now he's so proficient that he can pull his food out and gulp it down quickly. Not good because he vomited his breakfast one morning :-(. Now I only give him half his breakfast then wait 15 minutes to give him the rest. This is still better than when he had a regular cat dish. I also like that it's ceramic instead of plastic. It should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Wackie

customer_reviews.title: She does seem to enjoy using this bowl
customer_reviews.text: We got this bowl to try and help our obese cat (picture an over-inflated, fur-covered basketball with legs) lose weight. It does slow her down a little bit, but unfortunately she has proven highly skilled at all tasks that support her quest to acquire food. She can pull out the kibble at an impressive speed. She does seem to enjoy using this bowl, and I guess she does get a bit of exercise. Her right front leg and paw are getting pretty toned from her kibble extraction workouts. :-/
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This was a great solution for my GF 2 cats they both looked ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great solution for my GF 2 cats they both looked over their shoulder as they ate thinking the other one was going to eat it all. So they would gorge over the food and barf it up a few min to an hour later. This was a common occurrence (at least once a week if not more) each week and now is only happening maybe once a month. It has a nice wight to it and helps prevent the cats from tipping over. Also food would not last for over 3 hours before the new bowl and now we still see food 24 hours later. I am very happy with the purchase and so is my GF!
customer_reviews.author: idlegamer82

customer_reviews.title: Very Large Feeder
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a smaller similar version of this type of feeder which I have not been able to find anywhere so I tried these but found them just toooooo large. They seem like they'd be more appropriate for a large dog not cats. The surface was smooth, glaze lovely just too big in a small condo to have two of them out for our three cats so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Very Large Feeder
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a smaller similar version of this type of feeder which I have not been able to find anywhere so I tried these but found them just toooooo large. They seem like they'd be more appropriate for a large dog not cats. The surface was smooth, glaze lovely just too big in a small condo to have two of them out for our three cats so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good. Well Built. Just not for my feline
customer_reviews.text: Cool dish, but a bridge and claw to far for my felines. Quality is top, but not the product to reduce the scarf - and - barf overzealous eaters of the feline kind. This is a toy and works well like that. Not good for the daily feeder.
customer_reviews.author: WorldWriter

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: One cat took to it faster than the other, but they both had the hang of it by the end of the week and don't seem to mind having to work a bit for their meals:) it is worth it since they now eat more slowly than before. I think the lip on the edge is kind of required, otherwise they'd get all the food out too quickly. They still tend to finish off every little piece in there by supper time. This dish is big enough to hold maybe 3 cups of food at a time (just a guess), and my 2 cats have no problems sharing it.
customer_reviews.author: Arjasy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ceramic slow cat feeder.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have been looking for a non-plastic slow feeder for a while. The cats didn't need any help figuring it out or adjusting to it. It has stopped my cats eating too much too fast and I am no longer cleaning up food they threw up. It holds a decent amount of food, but with three cats I am still refilling it daily. I love the funnel shape in the top, it makes filling it extremely easy. You may have to push or shake down the food a bit if it remains in the funnel. Great product. I am considering getting a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Bladow

customer_reviews.title: Great for gobblers.
customer_reviews.text: My cats are gobblers! These work really well to slow them down and space out their eating. Especially when I want to leave extra food out for them if I leave town overnight. They are a lot bigger than you'd think though, and the cat has to have access to walk all the way around them to get all the food out. So, you may want to actually get a tape measure out if space is a premium for you.
customer_reviews.author: Karen P. Tibbals

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it!!! It did not take long for them to figure it out. I bought it because I have 1 cat who is a little piggy (in the video). She would clean her bowl and then eat the other cats' food. She was really food centered. Since purchasing this, she will eat, and then she will actually walk away with food still remaining in the bowl!!!! She also doesn't nag me for food all day anymore. I love watching them eat out of it. I would recommend getting another one if you have more than 2 cats.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: A great idea! A super feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding feeder. Our 8 year old cat figured it out in about 5 seconds. He enjoys "pawing" out his food. He is eating much less, and is getting down to a healthy weight. This was SO easy! (But then he is an intelligent cat:)) If you have a "robust" cat, this feeder could be your answer! Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for the better part of a year for a slow feeder that is not plastic or silicon as those materials exasterbate my orange tabby's chin acne. This feeder is a dream come true! Only took him a few minutes to figure it out. I love the top loading feature because I rigged a chute off my auto feeder & the kibbles go into the feeder instead of bouncing off everywhere. I absolutely love this & have already recommended it to other cat moms with fast eaters!
customer_reviews.author: ruthiepieinthesky

customer_reviews.title: Not good for canned or wet foods but great for dry
customer_reviews.text: This item didn't work well for my cat. We tried it for a few days and it was more frustrating foe her than a way to slow down the eating. It is nicely made and looks great but may or may not be a good option for your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Bannis

customer_reviews.title: Holes too small and too high from the base
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a similar contraption my cats have been eating out of for awhile ( because they were having a hard time pulling food out of the tunnels that were tilted higher and leaving it in there, demanding more food later instead of going for it. I thought this one would be easier for them. However, the picture is misleading. The holes are too small and too high in relation to the base and they have an even more difficult time pulling out the food and basically refused to eat out of it. I am trying a 3rd option...
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing interactive feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my kitten because I’ll be starting school soon + I’ll be working so I won’t be home to feed her regularly & she loves it. I ordered the white ceramic one. It feels very sturdy & good quality. Would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leandra

customer_reviews.title: I have five cats. Two of them can't figure ...
customer_reviews.text: I have five cats. Two of them can't figure out how to stick their paw in and flick the food out. They put their mouth up to the hole and grab what they can with their tongue. Lol I bought this because I have one fat cat that overeats. He is still as fat as ever and has not lost any weight, despite having this bowl for maybe six months or more. I also bought that purple slow feeder that has those blunt spikes sticking up. The cats never figured that one out, so I returned it. This one is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy Mom

customer_reviews.title: are you kidding.......just what are you selling anyway?
customer_reviews.text: the bottom of this unit is supposed to be raised and curved....my unit came with a smooth snap on cover...like a 'tupperware' cover. i had to go to the manufacturers website to get a clear picture of what the unit should really look like. i see this as a complete fraud. i am going to get a box and return this for a refund asap.
customer_reviews.author: sharona

customer_reviews.title: Classy puzzle feeder
customer_reviews.text: All the puzzle feeders I looked at before this one were either plastic or open-topped. I wanted black, solid, and ceramic to match the water dish. To be honest, I thought my cat would starve before she figured out how to bat food out, but she did get it. Fishing food out of the sides has reduced her rate of eating, which in turn makes her throw up less. Looks good, works as intended - worth it.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it hit the floor
customer_reviews.text: Loved this and it was somewhat dog proof until I ranvlow on food and the cat pushed it off the counter despite the rubber feet and mat that it was set on he was determined. I want another but for 30 dollars I'm debating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Things like this make one less mess in life
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because the ceramic one got thrown down the stairs during some big kitty Roughhousing tomfoolery. This slows my one fast/over eater so I don’t step in barf yuck ! I DO recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bears Momma

customer_reviews.title: This product was perfect for our family situation
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect for our family situation. We adopted two new puppies before Christmas, and they felt it was OK to eat from the dog or cat bowl. If your cats are like mine - they did NOT take kindly to A.) a repeatedly empty bowl, and B.) dog slobber in their food. The kitties quickly learned how to use the bowl. Their tiny hands and mouths fit just right in the openings, which were way too small for the dogs. Happy cats = a happy household.
customer_reviews.author: slynn

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for scarf n barfers!
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly like the picture, white porcelain bowl. I love it. I've noticed less manic behavior the "omg the bowl is empty hey the bowl is empty omg omg omg" since I ordered this bowl. My older cat figured it out right away which is great considering she's the fat one that was scarfing the food down and barfing but my year old cat is still figuring it out, so I pull food out of it for her. She won't mess with it if you're looking. The only negative I have with it is that since it's porcelain and all one piece, washing without a special scrubber is kinda difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could solve your cat's eating problems.
customer_reviews.text: Solved our cat's vomiting problems. He used to gorge himself twice a day as soon as we gave him his dry food. Not infrequently he would vomit it up shortly after. Now he has to work for his food. This bowl really slows him down. I think he probably enjoys "hunting" for his food too. Highly recommended for cats with no self-control.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: So far the cats are trying to figure it out. But I think it will work dor the cat I have the gorges herself then vomits. Guess time will tell but like the design and the cats were curious.. will provide and update when I see if it works.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for two reasons: 1- my cat ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for two reasons: 1- my cat would eat so fast that she would get sick 2- my cat is fat and I was told this would provide some playful activity, thus causing weight loss It helped with the fast eating but my cat has outsmarted the bowl. She drags the internal bowl to the side and scoops it out... while laying on her side. This hasn't helped with the weight issue. Overall I give it four stars bc if helps her from getting sick.
customer_reviews.author: SW082087

customer_reviews.title: Slows down Eating
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that slows down my cat. He can’t stick his head in the bowl and gulp everything in 30 seconds. He has to take each piece of food out to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: iBuyStuffFromAmazon

customer_reviews.title: My cats are too smart !
customer_reviews.text: This bowl worked really well at first, but after awhile my cats figured out some tricks. My smart female cat shoves her snout in the bowl holes and bites/licks whatever food is near the edge. This causes her to sometimes bite the bowl which I'm worried about her teeth already since she has mild gingivitis. My male cat has huge paws and paws out scoops at a time and inhales the rest of the food. This bowl did work for me for quite awhile, but I think my cats must be too smart!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mel

customer_reviews.title: Cats cats cats!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in August 2014. This bowl is very elegant! The ceramic gives it a sophisticated feel. I was very excited to watch the cats use it for the first time. Definitely slows them down. Another bonus is that now I can move the cat feeding off of the counter and down on the ground because the dogs don't have as much access to their food through those tiny holes. ***UPDATE!!!*** It is now August 2016. The bowl is still working great. No chipping in the ceramic, cats are very used to it, so much so, they they are getting fat again.... But definitely a quality product. Better than any plastic alternative.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: My cats (x4) love this ceramic feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this feeder. Especially now that my cats are on a diet where they no longer get dry food, this feeder helps me to give them a little dry food on occasion - and they have to "earn" it! I love watching them try to get at it from different angles. One cat is a poly, so I wondered if her paws would fit through the holes, but she does great. I used this before I removed dry food from their daily diet, and it helped slow down their pace of eating - and the overall amount that they ate - plus, it enabled more than one of them to eat from it at the same time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Worked so well I bought a second!
customer_reviews.text: This has almost completely eliminated the scarf & barfing habit of 2 of my cats. After several months they've become experts at fishing out food, but at least now they actually chew it instead of just inhaling it.
customer_reviews.author: Nematicon

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This keeps my kitten from inhaling her food. It didn’t take her long to figure out. It’s sturdy and has taken some drops to the floor without any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Vixenoforion

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well and is a beautiful ceramic dish
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my cats! They have no front claws and are able to get their dry food out one piece at a time! Does the job well and is a beautiful ceramic dish. Doesn't slide all over and cleans easily! Can be used for one cat or multiple cats.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Scarf and Barf saver
customer_reviews.text: My cat Mabel was a stray when I found her and when we brought her home she would eat like we were going to steal it back. We thought this behavior would slowly die down but it didn't and because it didn't our house will being covered in kitty barf. This bowl helps by making her slow down so she's not gulping down food and air. The only bad thing about this product is filling it, you have to do it slowly and stop and swirl the food in the bowl so you make more room at the top. (I know that sounds weird but that's how it goes)
customer_reviews.author: SarahDee

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps a little too difficult. I wish the ceramic design were more like the plastic one from the same manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: There is a lip on the inside edge which make it rather difficult for the cats to get the food out. Yes, this is the point, but I think it may be a little too difficult. My cats have to lodge a kibble in the pads of their paws, in order to pull them out. I love the ceramic material, but wish that the design were more like the plastic one. I appears (though it's hard to tell) that the plastic design allows the food to be swiped out more directly. It doesn't look like it has to be lifted over a lip/edge. See the plastic one here:
customer_reviews.author: Cloud Ponderer

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed cat food bowl
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to keep the dogs out of the cat food. 2 out of 3 of my cats figured out how to use it, which didn't surprise me. Unfortunately I had to continue to use traditional bowls so the less intelligent cat did not starve. I think most cats would find this enjoyable to use and it should also help deter overeating or scarfing food down too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cat feeder!! It is ceramic as it was listed. A perfect weighted feeder that has a little decrotive look to it. I purchased the black feeder. Put some food in it & showed our kitties how to get at the food. I believe this bowl will really help with our big boy from gorging himself.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Multiple Cats, but Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, Molly (my girlfriend's cat) is a bit overweight because I give her too many treats. In order to control her feeding, she is now using this. After some adjustment, I think Molly has dropped a bit of weight and doesn't gobble her food like she used to. The holes are large enough and the bowl holds a lot of dry food. My only gripe is that I think the bowl is a bit large, but it would be ideal for multiple cats.
customer_reviews.author: AMG77

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my small (skeletal wise) female, overweight cat who loves to inhale kibble and then beg for more. This product is so lightweight/flimsy that it is easily knocked over while the cat tries to finesse kibble out of the holes. The main kibble hopper in center uses gravity to release the food in theory. However the food stays stuck in the hopper no matter how full I fill it.( Yes the kibble is the smallest varieties) It does come with a place mat sized cloth to place feeder on , it does nothing to stabilize the item so it must be purely decorative. So in conclusion, good idea but poor execution. Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: That Other Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was like new with tags
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in White Ceramic as "used". Was like new with tags. Awesome item. My cat took a couple of days to warm up to the idea, but now she's used to it. She eats WAY slower, WAY less and hasn't thrown up since we got it. I'm a BIG fan of this item.
customer_reviews.author: briandrew1

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: This was good. We didn’t keep because we needed to get chip feeders but it was good and slowed eating. They will pull the food out into the floor however if you don’t want that.
customer_reviews.author: Phooey

customer_reviews.title: Slowed down cat's eating. Kind of reduced vomiting.
customer_reviews.text: My cat was a feral San Francisco cat and used to eat like she didn't know when her next meal was coming...and then often vomit. This bowl slowed down my fast-eating and vomit-loving feline. This hasn't reduced the vomiting to zero but I think it's slowed it down. I even use fill this bowl up all the way if I am going to be away for a couple of days and don't want to bother my roommate with feeding her. It's a little bit expensive and a tad hard to clean but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan23

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS LARGE
customer_reviews.text: The entire dish is ceramic and durable. The dish itself is rather large, which is perfect for multiple cat use. It was too large for my own uses, but I'm sure it would work great for someone else. Make sure to read the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stops the gulping - slows them down
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was needed! No more gulping down and then vomiting up! Plus it’s fun to watch them get the pieces out! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: button carey

customer_reviews.title: Success. Cat hates it. Doesn't throw up anymore though.
customer_reviews.text: Trying to help out my little fatty. She has mostly figured it out, still tries to stick her head in the holes. But since using the bowl she hasn't thrown up uneaten kibbles.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect feeder
customer_reviews.text: Essential for my cat who will hurriedly eat all her food only to immediately vomit it up. Slows her down and she doesn’t get sick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and care of packaging
customer_reviews.text: The bowl didn’t come with the top lid and the bottom part that was supposed to twist apart was pushed in/jammed. I know it’s not an expensive bowl, but this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: DMarie2047

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Cat HATES it, but it does the trick for helping her to not overeat. Good price, works better than dog ones which my cat figured out how to dump.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei Cleese

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if your cat scarfs and barfs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for slowing down my scarf and barfer. Smooth finish. Only suggestion I would have is to add rubber pads on the bottom. Mine tends to get dragged around the floor a hit as the cats reach in to get the food out.
customer_reviews.author: DueSouthFan

customer_reviews.title: Well made and functional.
customer_reviews.text: The dish is good quality and attractive. I was a little surprised by how large it is, but I understand that it needs to be so the cat must really reach and work for those bits of kibble! Our 6 month old kitten figured out how to use it within seconds and while it did slow her down, the change was not terribly dramatic. Perhaps if it had some interior dividers it might slow her down a bit more, which would be good in her case. Still, I do recommend this dish for making meal time a little more leisurely and interesting for kitties!
customer_reviews.author: mompie

customer_reviews.title: Turned my endless speed eater into a grazer
customer_reviews.text: With a regular bowl my cat would eat whatever was in front of him. Now with this bowl he eats slow enough to get full before the food is gone. Now he can graze throughout the day and not be so cranky. I give this product 1 MILLION STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Cat food dish
customer_reviews.text: It is a great feeding dish if you have an overeater. the only thing is, the way it is created it needs to sit on a wide enough surface. In my case the only place is the floor. So in the end my dog ends up licking the kitty food out before my kitty does. And also, this probably would not work as well with declawed kitties. Watching my cats eat out of it, they seemed to use their claws mostly for helping in getting out the food.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Sears

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a cat who overeats or tries to cover his/her food.
customer_reviews.text: My four year old shelter cat will a) either overeat or b) cover her food with whatever is available! Shoes/socks/blankets/shirts etc. This Pioneer Pet Tiger Diner Ceramic Food bowl is fabulous! It now takes her time to eat as she gets each individual piece out with her claws AND she doesn't try to cover her food anymore. Hurrah!
customer_reviews.author: Mother, Wife Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Dumb cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats are stupid. Instead of pawing out the food, they stick their noses in the holes and lick it out. Every morning it is half empty, so I guess that method works to a point. Now I have to fill it to the brim every morning. They do get wet food every day as well, so they won't starve. I am hoping they will lose some weight which was the whole point
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good feeder. Designed to challenge my kitties
customer_reviews.text: Very good feeder. Designed to challenge my kitties, slow them down, but not frustrate. Also, ceramic manufacture is solid and weighty, cats can't drag it around. Also very easy to clean. Has helped to reduce the amount of food consumed per sitting and the resulting throwing up or over-eating. Overall, excellent design, function and construction.
customer_reviews.author: shredbetty

customer_reviews.title: Genius Product For Every Cat Owner
customer_reviews.text: My fat cat was meowing constantly for more food, like every half hour, and we have dogs so anything left over was wasted. At first he had such a hard time figuring out how to get the food, but once he figured it out, he stopped crying for food, and while one dog can't get it out, the other can only get little bits. We've saved so much money on cat food, and my fat cat is starting to look a little healthier and more active. I highly recommend this for anyone with a needy cat, a fat lazy cat, or dogs that keep eating the cat food. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great slow feeder for cats
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder for my cats. It helps them not eat as fast. The only downfall is that the feeder needs a rubber felt underneath so the cats do not make noise when they push it across the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but my for my cat
customer_reviews.text: I knew this would be perfect for my over eater. The only problem is, she will not put her paw in and get food out. We tried it for over 2 weeks and even tried to teach her but she just would not. I would love to use this but I don't want her to starve in the process
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Two paws up
customer_reviews.text: My male kitty had a bad habit of gobbling his food down too fast and then getting sick. I got him this and now he eats his food much more slowly and actually eats less at each meal, my vet says this is because he has to think about his eating, nice to know cats have food issues, too. Dishwasher safe and holds several days worth of food. Also keeps my multiple cats from fighting at the food bowl, now they stake out a position and mealtime is a lot more peaceful.
customer_reviews.author: Prity_Kittie

customer_reviews.title: Cat is too smart.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is just too smart. He scoops it all out and then gobbles it down and proceeds to throw it up. Not for the smart butt cat.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY! Something to slow down my fast eater. I have 2 cats and one is a normal 8 pound tiny thing, and the other is a 13 pound pig! (no not a literal pig, but he might as well be). He will eat until he is so bloated that he can't eat anymore. This bowl has slowed him down drastically and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Evyn

customer_reviews.title: my cats give this dish/bowl one star (they hate it)
customer_reviews.text: This dish is well made and attractive (well to me). The cats sniffed it. One cat put her paw in the dish but since there is a small lip around the edge, she could not get out even one piece of dry food. She turned around and ignored the dish entirely. The other cat did not even look at it. I decided to follow the instructions of another reader and put the cat food on a small plate on one level. The cats like it. It prevents them from over eating or eating to fast.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Harris

customer_reviews.title: Frustration for Kitties
customer_reviews.text: It slowed the rate of the cats' eating, which is its aim. As a result they have not been regurgitating food and have lost some weight. The design is good. It is a good weight, but would benefit from something to increase the friction at the base. The cats have to put their paws in and pull out the kibbles. This sometimes causes the whole bowl to move. Otherwise, it's a good prodcut
customer_reviews.author: nutbag

customer_reviews.title: Great to make your pets work for the food!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 cats. One of the cats loves to eat as much as he can and will push others out of the way to get more. We bought a few of these and placed them in different parts of the house. I love the dishes because it makes the cat work for the food and makes them slow down when they eat. It didn't take long for them to figure out how to use it and they don't seem to mind working for their food a little harder. If something happens to the other dishes we have I'll def order more.
customer_reviews.author: AJN

customer_reviews.title: Take the Time to Train Your Kitty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dish because my cat eats too quickly and then throws up (pylorospasm), so I wanted to slow down his food intake enough to address the issue. It took a few days of "training" the cat to use the dish. We put his paws in the little holes and then also put small dabs of wet food inside to encourage him. Now he uses the bowl without any difficulty, and I'm happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: HBG

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't move around or come apart like the plastic version
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these that I have purchased - one for each of my cats. Doesn't move around or come apart like the plastic version. Easy to clean in the dishwasher. Keeps cats from eating too fast and getting sick.
customer_reviews.author: crackerjackheart

customer_reviews.title: So far so good....
customer_reviews.text: In trying to help our 25 pound cat lose weight, my vet suggested trying an "odd shaped food bowl" to slow down his eating. So I found this bowl and decided to give it a go. It took our cat a couple days to get the hand of it, but now he's using it and it is definitely slowing down his eating. He has lost 1 pound over the last 3 months so we are making progress. He still eats from our other cat's bowl, but he's really gotten the hang of this bowl and mostly uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: I don't think he finds this entertaining so much as annoying, which is the only reason I'm withholding the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is slowed my cat's mealtime down astronomically. I don't think he likes it very much, as he gives me the evil eye when I put food in it, but before he was wolfing down his food in 30 seconds and then immediately begging for more. This keeps him occupied longer, and he doesn't wind up begging right away (usually). He typically finishes the food, although he does resort to pushing the entire dish around in his efforts, so the dish migrates. I don't think he finds this entertaining so much as annoying, which is the only reason I'm withholding the 5th star. Overall, the humans in the house are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mart10

customer_reviews.title: Best cat dish ever
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my two cats, as I wanted to keep them thinking and also reduce likelihood of overeating. I usually fill it once every 1.5 days.The small effort of having to paw out the food means that if they are bored, and nothing is in the top dish, they don't bother, keeping them trim and fit. Only flaw if that it can be difficult to wash and dry well - you need the right tools for the job.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Getting Kitty In Shape!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two months ago because my cat had ballooned up to 15 pounds. It took her a day or two to figure out how to use it, but since then she's had no trouble and doesn't seem too annoyed by it... Also, she's lost 2.5 pounds. She has so much more energy now, even though she's still a little chub. The weight loss does seem to have leveled off but even if she doesn't lose any more I'm still happy with the results. Also I go through less food now. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ASX

customer_reviews.title: best purchase I ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I ever made my cat used to eat too fast .it has totally cured her love this product and she is declawed has no problems getting the food out I put one scoop a day in and she grazes all day .love this dish!!!
customer_reviews.author: MARY LOU

product_meta.title: Pioneer Pet SmartCat Tiger Diner Cat Feeder
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe number one problem with most food dishes is that they allow cats to eat too much. The Tiger Diner fixes all that with a design that challenges cats to fetch out their own food. They will eat only as much as they need, so there's less waste and less overeating. The Tiger Diner also helps aid in digestion and stop stomach upsets due to eating too fast.
feature_bullets: Funnel-Shaped Bowl is easy to load and automatically distributes food as needed
Cats enjoy mental & physical stimulation, while eating at a healthier speed
Cats eat less – saves money on food bill. No boredom eating - exercise with natural prey drive to capture food.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
